name: AI Agent Marketplace
reasoning: Huge projected TAM ($80-100B by 2030) but OpenAI GPT Store already exists, Hugging Face expanding. Marketplace needs critical mass of both agents and users (chicken-and-egg). No special moat for MuteLab vs well-funded competitors building the same thing.

name: MCP Hub
reasoning: MCP ecosystem is real and growing, but Smithery, mcp.run, Glama already exist and Anthropic/OpenAI may build official registries. Registry is buildable by AI+1 human, but we have no MCP community standing or developer audience to bootstrap adoption.

name: Autonomous Business Machine
reasoning: Massive vision but extremely complex to execute well. End-to-end business automation (store, marketing, billing, support) is far beyond what AI+1 human at 2hrs/week can build reliably. Shopify Magic, Wix AI, Base44, and dozens of vibe-coding tools competing. No unique edge.

name: AgentProof
reasoning: Braintrust ($80M at $800M val) validates demand, but they plus Langfuse (open-source), LangSmith, Arize, and 17+ other tools make this extremely crowded. An SDK+dashboard is technically buildable, but competing against well-funded teams with no observability domain expertise is a losing battle.

name: x402 Gateway
reasoning: x402 is genuinely new and few are building on it yet — real timing advantage. Thanapat's blockchain background fits perfectly for payment infrastructure. But the problem isn't severe yet — few agents actually transact autonomously today. The $30T projection is fantasy for 2030. Coinbase may build their own easy layer.

name: VibeBuild Thailand
reasoning: Thai market limits TAM significantly. Thai SMEs already use Shopee/LINE shops. Global tools (Bolt.new, Lovable, Base44) could add Thai language support trivially — language is not a real moat. Needs deep PromptPay/LINE integrations that take significant engineering effort.

name: AI Agent Reputation Protocol
reasoning: Novel concept with few competitors, and blockchain CTO fits well. But the core problem doesn't exist yet — agents barely transact autonomously today, so reputation is premature. Protocol adoption requires massive network effects that a 2-person team can't bootstrap. Too early for this market.

name: LINE AI Assistant Platform
reasoning: Real pain point — Thai shops manually answering LINE chats is genuinely painful. Technically feasible with LINE API + LLM. But LINE itself is adding AI features, many Thai chatbot companies already exist (ZWIZ.AI, etc.), and onboarding requires shop-by-shop sales effort that doesn't scale with 2hrs/week from Thanapat.

name: SynthData.io
reasoning: Growing market ($2.5B by 2030) and Thai language data is genuinely scarce. But Scale AI, Appen, and dozens of synthetic data startups are well-established. Quality validation requires serious domain expertise and human review. Enterprise sales cycles for training data are long. No unique data moat.

name: AgentOS
reasoning: Agent management is coming but few companies have multiple agents yet — market is premature. CrewAI, AutoGen, LangGraph, and Microsoft Copilot Studio are all competing here with serious funding. Building a robust orchestration platform is complex. Our OpenClaw experience is relevant but small-scale.

name: ShopCopilot
reasoning: Thai sellers genuinely struggle with listings and pricing — 75% say they need AI help. Graas.ai ($9M raised) validates demand but is enterprise/English-focused. AI listing generation is feasible to build. But Shopee/Lazada are adding native AI tools, and we have no e-commerce expertise or seller network.

name: CreatorClone
reasoning: China proved AI avatars can sell ($7M in 6hrs) but building avatar training, video generation, and marketplace integration is extremely complex. Depends on HeyGen/Gemelo APIs we don't control. No video/avatar expertise. TikTok may ban AI-only streams. Too technically ambitious for our team.

name: GreenChain Thailand
reasoning: KBank BOT sandbox validates Thai regulatory readiness. Water Ledger experience is directly transferable — strongest 'our advantage' play. But carbon credit verification is genuinely complex, Thai market is small, ESG is regulatory-driven not burning pain, and needs TGO integration and institutional partnerships that take months.

name: NarrateAI
reasoning: Thai podcast market is tiny and podcasting is a vitamin not painkiller. Technically feasible as an ElevenLabs API wrapper, but that means no moat — anyone can build this. ElevenLabs or Spotify could add Thai text-to-podcast trivially. No content/creator expertise or audience.

name: QueryBrain
reasoning: Text-to-SQL is proven technology and Thai SMEs genuinely struggle with data analysis. No Thai-first NL-to-SQL tool exists yet. But global BI tools (Power BI Copilot, Tableau) are rapidly adding multilingual support. Thai NL accuracy is harder than English. Limited TAM in Thailand alone. No BI domain expertise.

name: LoyaltyOS
reasoning: Web3 loyalty is growing (24.8% CAGR) and no Thai player exists. Blockchain CTO fits well for tokenomics design. But brands have existing loyalty programs with high switching costs, 'blockchain' is still a hard sell to mainstream Thai brands, and building requires brand-by-brand enterprise sales that doesn't fit 2hrs/week.

name: DealFlow.ai
reasoning: Cash flow is a real SME killer and PromptBiz creates regulatory tailwind. But this requires bank partnerships (months of institutional sales), potential financial licensing, credit risk management, and deep banking relationships. Far too complex and regulated for AI + 2hrs/week human. One wrong credit decision = disaster.

name: KOL.ai
reasoning: SEA creator economy is large ($26B) but Narrators already has 1.3M creators, TikTok has Creator Marketplace, and building a two-sided marketplace from scratch needs massive investment in both supply and demand. No influencer marketing expertise, creator network, or brand relationships.

name: RWA Studio
reasoning: Strongest 'our advantage' score — Water Ledger IS RWA tokenization, just for water. $33B market with institutional validation (BlackRock, Goldman). Thailand BOT sandbox is real. But Securitize ($47M raised) and InvestaX exist, regulatory complexity in each country is massive, and enterprise sales cycles are 6-12 months. Build feasibility limited by legal/compliance requirements beyond code.

name: DevSage
reasoning: Technically very feasible — wrap Claude API with good UX for code review and mentoring. Sun can literally be the product. But GitHub Copilot, Cursor ($20M ARR), CodeRabbit, and many others are well-funded and expanding. SEA focus is a thin differentiator. Commoditization risk is high as LLM costs drop.
